snippet: The team placed running back Jonathan Dwyer on the reserve/nonfootball illness list, opening a spot on their roster, a day after he was arrested on charges of aggravated assault against his wife and 17-month-old son.
abstract: Arizona Cardinals backup running back Jonathan Dwyer is deactivated after he is arrested on charges of aggravated assault against his wife and 17-month-old son and four other counts, all from incidents that took place in July; team places him on the reserve/nonfootball illness list, which opens a spot for him to be replaced on the roster.

byline.contributor: Ben Shpigel contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The team placed running back Jonathan Dwyer on the reserve/nonfootball illness list, opening a spot on their roster, a day after he was arrested on charges of aggravated assault against his wife and 17-month-old son.

headline.main: Arizona Cardinals Distance Themselves From Jonathan Dwyer
